paragraphs.content: Psalm 49
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 49

paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Psalm for the sons of Korah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Psalm for the sons of Korah.

paragraphs.content: Hear this, all ye people; give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear this, all ye people; give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world:

paragraphs.content: Both low and high, rich and poor, together.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Both low and high, rich and poor, together.

paragraphs.content: My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.

paragraphs.content: I will incline mine ear to a parable: I will open my dark saying upon the harp.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will incline mine ear to a parable: I will open my dark saying upon the harp.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil, when the iniquity of my heels shall compass me about?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil, when the iniquity of my heels shall compass me about?

paragraphs.content: They that trust in their wealth, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;
paragraphs.contentHtml: They that trust in their wealth, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;

paragraphs.content: None of them can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him:
paragraphs.contentHtml: None of them can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him:

paragraphs.content: (For the redemption of their soul is precious, and it ceaseth for ever:)
paragraphs.contentHtml: (For the redemption of their soul is precious, and it ceaseth for ever:)

paragraphs.content: That he should still live for ever, and not see corruption.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That he should still live for ever, and not see corruption.

paragraphs.content: For he seeth that wise men die, likewise the fool and the brutish person perish, and leave their wealth to others.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he seeth that wise men die, likewise the fool and the brutish person perish, and leave their wealth to others.

paragraphs.content: Their inward thought is, that their houses shall continue for ever, and their dwelling places to all generations; they call their lands after their own names.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Their inward thought is, that their houses shall continue for ever, and their dwelling places to all generations; they call their lands after their own names.

paragraphs.content: Nevertheless man being in honour abideth not: he is like the beasts that perish.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Nevertheless man being in honour abideth not: he is like the beasts that perish.

paragraphs.content: This their way is their folly: yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: This their way is their folly: yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah.

paragraphs.content: Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death shall feed on them; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their beauty shall consume in the grave from their dwelling.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death shall feed on them; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their beauty shall consume in the grave from their dwelling.

paragraphs.content: But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for he shall receive me. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for he shall receive me. Selah.

paragraphs.content: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased;

paragraphs.content: For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away: his glory shall not descend after him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away: his glory shall not descend after him.

paragraphs.content: Though while he lived he blessed his soul: and men will praise thee, when thou doest well to thyself.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Though while he lived he blessed his soul: and men will praise thee, when thou doest well to thyself.

paragraphs.content: He shall go to the generation of his fathers; they shall never see light.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shall go to the generation of his fathers; they shall never see light.

paragraphs.content: Man that is in honour, and understandeth not, is like the beasts that perish.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Man that is in honour, and understandeth not, is like the beasts that perish.
